summary.p: Assures Bullinger that he will gladly assist his [nephew] Johann Heinrich Göldli; the latter will report himself. Offers his services and asks for indulgence for his brief writing.

div.p: Especially gracious, dear sir. Regarding your letter and request concerning Mr. Hans Heinrich Göldli, my dear nephew, I want to let you know that I, along with others, am willing to help him gladly according to your and Mr. Heinrich Göldli's letter, as he will inform you himself. I also want to commend him to you.

I also wish to commend myself to you before God and in time, offering whatever friendship, love, and kindness I can show you, finding me always willing. I ask you to kindly overlook my poor writing (take it in good part), as I am so tired of writing that I can no longer do it. With that, I commend us to God, and whatever is dear to you. May God protect us all.
Given in the valley of Schramberg, on Monday after St. Andrew's Day in the year 1538.
To the honorable Master Heinrich Bullinger, preacher at the Grossmünster in Zurich, my especially gracious, dear sir.
